• Assessed risk factors in revolutionary 2018 product and proposed unique thermal solution that minimizes customer adoption burden while delivering adequate thermal budget, overcoming previously understood thermal limitations. 
• Set and ensured accurate product thermal recommendations on all client products for 2014 by working with factory and customer-facing organizations.  
• Resolved launch-gating issues on high publicity products, enabling timely production and shipment. Key contributions: 
• Performed CFD analysis for Intel reference design of passively cooled tablet with groundbreaking thinness, unveiled at Computex 2014, unequivocally resetting the industry understanding of consumer device form factors and performance with Intel silicon.

Summary I have worked at Intel Corporation for 26 years in desktop and server product development and I am currently a Sr. Mechanical Engineer in the Product Collaboration & Systems Division. I am responsible for electro-mechanical design of complex server products for both internal and outsourced product development programs. I have worked on full internal designs, hybrid outsource designs with Asian partner companies and fully outsource electro-mechanical design projects. For the fully outsourced designs my role has been more a mechanical design project manager overseeing the product development by oversees teams at partner companies to make sure the final designs meets the Intel product requirements and quality. I travel to Asia once or twice a year for tooling design reviews, HT first article approvals and early factory builds of our products. Intel has been a challenging, exciting and often crazy place to work for all these years. 
 
Specialties: Electro-Mechanical Server/System design using Pro Engineer and SpaceClaim. Sheetmetal and plastic component detail design and testing. Collaboration engineering. Hard tooling product development and FAI PPAP process. Internal and Outsourced product development from concept to production. Summary Over 25 years experience in development, design, documentation, and manufacture of components and systems in the electronics, computer, aerospace, defense, and medical device industries. I have gained considerable expertise in injection molded plastics design, sheet metal enclosures, machined components, and tooling. I am an advanced user of the latest 3D Modeling CAD tools including Creo Parametric (all versions), Pro-E Wildfire (most versions), AutoCad, Solidworks 2014, CorelCad, CorelDraw, etc. In addition I have gained significant knowledge of many MRP, PLM, and PDM tools. And I have achieved expert level in all Microsoft Office applications. Have played lead roles in the development and implementation of interdepartmental processes and procedures addressing the issues of life cycle/configuration management; materials management; manufacturing; change control; part numbering systems; incoming inspection; quality control systems; and compliance & regulatory. Intimately familiar with the significant business issues involved in bringing products to market and the tasks confronting product release having participated in every effort from product definition to EOL. Most recent experience includes medical device manufacturing and tooling including the utilization of Six Sigma methodologies and adherance to FDA/ISO requirements.
